result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
09:45 AM Defendant Shakyia Monyia Wesley in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review hearing.
Parties have reviewed the report filed by Dr. Niess. 
Attorney Menden is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctors report.
The Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to attain competency within statutory time limits.  
The Court, upon making the finding, suspends the criminal proceedings.
Atty Menden will submit credit days for the Order to Treatment. 
Court orders the Defendant to remain in custody until transport to Mendota is possible. 

  Review hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by Dr. Jenna Niess.
Review hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed by CC Costello on 07/01/2022.

10:07 AM Defendant Shakyia Monyia Wesley in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez for attorney Eryn M Menden.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
The Court will adjourn.  Review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
